      • isMatch

        public static boolean isMatch(java.lang.String name,
                              java.util.regex.Pattern included,
                              java.util.regex.Pattern excluded)
        Checks if the name filters through an including and an excluding regular expression.
        Parameters:
        name - The String that will be filtered.
        included - The regular expressions that needs to succeed.
        excluded - The regular expressions that needs to fail.
        Returns:
        true if the name filtered through correctly; or false otherwise.

      • isMatch

        public static boolean isMatch(java.lang.String name,
                              java.util.regex.Pattern[] included,
                              java.util.regex.Pattern[] excluded)
        Checks if the name filters through a series of including and excluding regular expressions.
        Parameters:
        name - The String that will be filtered.
        included - An array of regular expressions that need to succeed
        excluded - An array of regular expressions that need to fail
        Returns:
        true if the name filtered through correctly; or false otherwise.

      • replace

        public static byte[] replace(byte[] Bytes,
                             char Old,
                             char New)
        Replaces all occurences of char of one type with another char in a given byte array and returns it. Change is made to the byte array and it is also returned.
        Parameters:
        Bytes - the byte array to change bytes in.
        Old - the char to find, converted to a byte by the lower eight bits, ignoring the higher eight bits.
        New - the char to replace all occurences of Old char converted to a byte by the lower eight bits, ignoring the higher eight bits.
        Returns:
        the changed byte array.

      • replace

        public static byte[] replace(byte[] Bytes,
                             java.lang.String Old,
                             java.lang.String New)
        Replaces one String with another where it occurs of a byte array making a new array due to the possibility of different size. Goes through the array just once, so any new occurances of Old String that appear due to the New String replacement are not replaced. Does no change to the byte array parameter Bytes.
        Parameters:
        Bytes - the byte array copy and search through but does no change to this parameter, returning the resulting byte array.
        Old - the old String to replace.
        New - the new String to replace Old String with.
        Returns:
        the new byte array with replacements done.

      • replace

        public static java.lang.String replace(java.lang.String Text,
                                       java.lang.String Old,
                                       java.lang.String New)
        Used to replace one String segment with another String segment inside a String. Similar to the replace method in String but instead of using char it uses String for replacing old with new.
        Parameters:
        Text - The String from which is produced the new String with which replacement has occurred.
        Old - The old String that is replaced by the new one in The Text String.
        New - The new String to replace the old String in the Text String.
        Returns:
        The new String with replacement having occurred.
